metadata.dc:description: We retrospectively review 893 cases of children, occurred in epidemic bout in September-October 1987, in order to study the usual management of his pathology in our hospital. In most cases (82.3%) diagnose was laryngitis or acute laryngitis without specification acute laryngotracheitis or spasmodic group. Epiglottitis was no detected in any case. Complementary tests were performed only in 5% of the patients, but they were of little help for the diagnose. Treatment applied was ambiental hummidiffication (95.5%), followed by water and alcohol impregned neck collar (87.2%), rectal magnesium-sulfate + papaverine (67.5%), epinephrine nebulization (63%), antibiotics (44.3%), steroids (9%), bronchodilatadors (4.8%). This therapeutic approach is discussed.
metadata.dc:title: Epidemia de laringitis (893 casos LTA y CE). II. Aspectos clínicos, diagnósticos y terapéuticos.
[Laryngitis epidemic (893 cases of acute laryngotracheitis and spastic croup). II. Clinical, diagnostic and therapeutic aspects].
